topic.title: Vendor Profile
topic.p: A Vendor is an entity that publishes and represents plugins on JetBrains Marketplace. You can upload a plugin as an individual vendor or an organization.
If you distribute plugins on behalf of an organization or plan to sell them as an individual, you should create an Organization entity.

Each plugin must be associated with a vendor or an organization. This requirement ensures that users can easily identify the vendor responsible for a plugin and understand their status (trader/non-trader), in compliance with the EU consumer protection rules.
Individual vendors and organizations each have their own dedicated vendor pages where their plugins are listed, providing users with a centralized view.

note.p: The vendor name displayed in the Plugin Manager and web Marketplace is now obtained from your Hub account. However, for installed plugins, the vendor name will continue to be extracted from the plugin.xml file.

chapter.title: Individual Vendor Profile
chapter.p: The Individual Vendor Profile page allows you to manage your plugins and provide your personal details on JetBrains Marketplace. The profile is automatically created when you upload your first plugin.

p.a: You can edit your vendor profile details here.

chapter.p: In your Vendor profile, you can update the following information:
Vendor name: The name is automatically fetched from your Hub account. However, you can update this field manually if necessary.
Email: We recommend providing your email address. It will be publicly available and can serve as the primary contact for any communication related to your plugins.
Website: This field is optional, but you are welcome to provide a link if you have a website or wish to share your GitHub profile, for example.

Vendor Profile status: Declare whether you are a trader or a non-trader. This information helps inform consumers about the application of EU consumer protection laws. For more details, refer to the relevant documentation. Learn more.

chapter.title: Organization
chapter.p: Detailed steps for creating and managing organizations can be found here.
To access the organization of which you are an admin or member, please navigate to your personal profile and switch to the Organization tab.
In the Organization profile, you can update the following information:
Organization name: Specify the official name of your organization. This will be displayed in this profile and associated with your plugins.
Email: Provide your email address. It will be publicly available and can serve as the primary contact for any communication related to your plugins.
Website: Include a valid website URL for your organization.

Vendor profile status: Declare whether you are a trader or a non-trader. This information helps inform consumers about the application of EU consumer protection laws. For more details, refer to the relevant documentation. Learn more.
Description: Provide a concise description of your organization. This allows users to understand your organization's area of expertise, or any relevant information you'd like to share.
Country: Specify the country where your organization is based. This helps users identify the geographical location of your organization.
